wikipedia_page.main: James Hitchmough (21 September 1934 – May 1997) was a TV comedy writer, teacher and academic.  He was best known for the long-running television sitcom Watching, but also wrote for Coronation Street and Brookside; and a feature-length TV film The Bullion Boys.

response: The series was written by Jim Hitchmough and starred Paul Bown and Emma Wray as mismatched couple Malcolm Stoneway and Brenda Wilson.
A novel based on the first series of Watching and written by Jim Hitchmough was published in 1990 by Bantam Books.
*5 July – Watching, Jim Hitchmough's comedy about a mismatched couple, and starring Paul Bown and Emma Wray, debuts on ITV.
